service: AWS Resilience Hub helps you proactively prepare and protect your Amazon Web Services applications from disruptions. Resilience Hub offers continuous resiliency assessment and validation that integrates into your software development lifecycle. This enables you to uncover resiliency weaknesses, ensure recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) targets for your applications are met, and resolve issues before they are released into production.

operations.AddDraftAppVersionResourceMappings: Adds the resource mapping for the draft application version.
operations.CreateApp:
Creates a Resilience Hub application. A Resilience Hub application is a collection of Amazon Web Services resources structured to prevent and recover Amazon Web Services application disruptions. To describe a Resilience Hub application, you provide an application name, resources from one or more–up to five–CloudFormation stacks, and an appropriate resiliency policy.

 <p>After you create a Resilience Hub application, you publish it so that you can run a resiliency assessment on it. You can then use recommendations from the assessment to improve resiliency by running another assessment, comparing results, and then iterating the process until you achieve your goals for recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO).</p>
operations.CreateResiliencyPolicy: Creates a resiliency policy for an application.
operations.DeleteApp: Deletes an AWS Resilience Hub application. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.
operations.DeleteAppAssessment: Deletes an AWS Resilience Hub application assessment. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.
operations.DeleteRecommendationTemplate: Deletes a recommendation template. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.
operations.DeleteResiliencyPolicy: Deletes a resiliency policy. This is a destructive action that can't be undone.
operations.DescribeAppAssessment: Describes an assessment for an AWS Resilience Hub application.
operations.DescribeAppVersionResourcesResolutionSta: Returns the resolution status for the specified resolution identifier for an application version. If resolutionId is not specified, the current resolution status is returned.
operations.DescribeAppVersionTemplate: Describes details about an AWS Resilience Hub
operations.DescribeDraftAppVersionResourcesImportSt: Describes the status of importing resources to an application version.
operations.DescribeResiliencyPolicy: Describes a specified resiliency policy for an AWS Resilience Hub application. The returned policy object includes creation time, data location constraints, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the policy, tags, tier, and more.
operations.ImportResourcesToDraftAppVersion: Imports resources from sources such as a CloudFormation stack, resource-groups, or application registry app to a draft application version.
operations.ListAlarmRecommendations: Lists the alarm recommendations for a AWS Resilience Hub application.
operations.ListAppAssessments: Lists the assessments for an AWS Resilience Hub application. You can use request parameters to refine the results for the response object.
operations.ListAppComponentCompliances: Lists the compliances for an AWS Resilience Hub component.
operations.ListAppComponentRecommendations: Lists the recommendations for an AWS Resilience Hub component.
operations.ListAppVersionResourceMappings: Lists how the resources in an application version are mapped/sourced from. Mappings can be physical resource identifiers, CloudFormation stacks, resource-groups, or an application registry app.
operations.ListAppVersionResources: Lists all the resources in an application version.
operations.ListAppVersions: Lists the different versions for the Resilience Hub applications.
operations.ListRecommendationTemplates: Lists the recommendation templates for the Resilience Hub applications.
operations.ListResiliencyPolicies: Lists the resiliency policies for the Resilience Hub applications.
operations.ListSopRecommendations: Lists the standard operating procedure (SOP) recommendations for the Resilience Hub applications.
operations.ListSuggestedResiliencyPolicies: Lists the suggested resiliency policies for the Resilience Hub applications.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists the tags for your resources in your Resilience Hub applications.
operations.ListTestRecommendations: Lists the test recommendations for the Resilience Hub application.
operations.ListUnsupportedAppVersionResources: Lists the resources that are not currently supported in AWS Resilience Hub. An unsupported resource is a resource that exists in the object that was used to create an app, but is not supported by Resilience Hub.
operations.PublishAppVersion: Publishes a new version of a specific Resilience Hub application.
operations.PutDraftAppVersionTemplate: Adds or updates the app template for a draft version of a Resilience Hub app.
operations.RemoveDraftAppVersionResourceMappings: Removes resource mappings from a draft application version.
operations.ResolveAppVersionResources: Resolves the resources for an application version.
operations.StartAppAssessment: Creates a new application assessment for an application.
operations.TagResource: Applies one or more tags to a resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes one or more tags from a resource.

AccessDeniedException.base: You don't have permissions to perform the requested operation. The user or role that is making the request must have at least one IAM permissions policy attached that grants the required permissions.

AlarmRecommendation.base: Defines a recommendation for a CloudWatch alarm.

refs.ListAlarmRecommendationsResponse$alarmRe: The alarm recommendations for an AWS Resilience Hub application, returned as an object. This object includes application component names, descriptions, information about whether a recommendation has already been implemented or not, prerequisites, and more.

refs.CreateAppResponse$app: The created application returned as an object with details including compliance status, creation time, description, resiliency score, and more.
refs.DescribeAppResponse$app: The specified application, returned as an object with details including compliance status, creation time, description, resiliency score, and more.
refs.UpdateAppResponse$app: The specified application, returned as an object with details including compliance status, creation time, description, resiliency score, and more.

refs.DescribeAppAssessmentResponse$assessment: The assessment for an AWS Resilience Hub application, returned as an object. This object includes Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), compliance information, compliance status, cost, messages, resiliency scores, and more.

refs.ListAppAssessmentsResponse$assessmentSum: The summaries for the specified assessments, returned as an object. This object includes application versions, associated Amazon Resource Numbers (ARNs), cost, messages, resiliency scores, and more.

refs.App$complianceStatus: The current status of compliance for the resiliency policy.
refs.AppSummary$complianceStatus: The current status of compliance for the resiliency policy.

AppComponentCompliance.base: Defines the compliance of an application component against the resiliency policy.

refs.PhysicalResource$appComponents: The application components that belong to this resource.

refs.RecommendationItem$alreadyImplemented: Specifies if the recommendation has already been implemented.
refs.UpdateAppRequest$clearResiliencyPolicyAr: Specifies if the resiliency policy ARN should be cleared.

ConflictException.base: Occurs when a conflict with a previous successful write is detected. This generally occurs when the previous write did not have time to propagate to the host serving the current request. A retry (with appropriate backoff logic) is the recommended response to this exception.

refs.PhysicalResourceId$awsAccountId: The Amazon Web Services account that owns the physical resource.

refs.UpdateResiliencyPolicyRequest$dataLocati: Specifies a high-level geographical location constraint for where your resilience policy data can be stored.

DisruptionCompliance.base: Defines the compliance against the resiliency policy for a disruption.

refs.UpdateResiliencyPolicyRequest$policy: The type of resiliency policy to be created, including the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds.

refs.PhysicalResourceId$type:
Specifies the type of physical resource identifier.

Arn

The resource identifier is an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) .

Native

The resource identifier is a Resilience Hub-native identifier.

PhysicalResource.base: Defines a physical resource. A physical resource is a resource that exists in your account. It can be identified using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a Resilience Hub-native identifier.

refs.UnsupportedResource$physicalResourceId: The physical resource identifier for the unsupported resource.

refs.ListAppVersionResourcesResponse$physical: The physical resources in the application version.

refs.ConfigRecommendation$recommendationCompl: The expected compliance against the resiliency policy after applying the configuration change.

refs.CreateRecommendationTemplateRequest$reco: Identifiers for the recommendations used to create a recommendation template.
refs.RecommendationTemplate$recommendationIds: Identifiers for the recommendations used in the recommendation template.

RecommendationTemplate.base: Defines a recommendation template created with the CreateRecommendationTemplate action.

refs.CreateRecommendationTemplateResponse$rec: The newly created recommendation template, returned as an object. This object includes the template's name, format, status, tags, Amazon S3 bucket location, and more.

refs.ListRecommendationTemplatesResponse$reco: The recommendation templates for the Resilience Hub applications.

refs.CreateRecommendationTemplateRequest$reco:
An array of strings that specify the recommendation template type or types.

Alarm

The template is an AlarmRecommendation template.

Sop

The template is a SopRecommendation template.

Test

The template is a TestRecommendation template.
refs.RecommendationTemplate$recommendationTyp:
An array of strings that specify the recommendation template type or types.

Alarm

The template is an AlarmRecommendation template.

Sop

The template is a SopRecommendation template.

Test

The template is a TestRecommendation template.

refs.ListResiliencyPoliciesResponse$resilienc: The resiliency policies for the Resilience Hub applications.
refs.ListSuggestedResiliencyPoliciesResponse$: The suggested resiliency policies for the Resilience Hub applications.

refs.CreateResiliencyPolicyResponse$policy: The type of resiliency policy that was created, including the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds.
refs.DescribeResiliencyPolicyResponse$policy: Information about the specific resiliency policy, returned as an object. This object includes creation time, data location constraints, its name, description, tags, the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds, and more.
refs.UpdateResiliencyPolicyResponse$policy: The type of resiliency policy that was updated, including the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds.

refs.CreateResiliencyPolicyRequest$tier: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity (MissionCritical) to lowest (NonCritical).
refs.ResiliencyPolicy$tier: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity (MissionCritical) to lowest (NonCritical).
refs.UpdateResiliencyPolicyRequest$tier: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity (MissionCritical) to lowest (NonCritical).

ResiliencyScore.base: The overall resiliency score, returned as an object that includes the disruption score and outage score.

refs.AppAssessment$resiliencyScore: The current resiliency score for the application.
refs.AppComponentCompliance$resiliencyScore: The current resiliency score for the application.

refs.ConflictException$resourceId: The identifier of the resource that the exception applies to.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceId: The identifier of the resource that the exception applies to.

refs.AddDraftAppVersionResourceMappingsReques: Mappings used to map logical resources from the template to physical resources. You can use the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application template uses a logical stack name. Or you can map individual resources by using the mapping type RESOURCE. We recommend using the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application is backed by a CloudFormation stack.
refs.AddDraftAppVersionResourceMappingsRespon: Mappings used to map logical resources from the template to physical resources. You can use the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application template uses a logical stack name. Or you can map individual resources by using the mapping type RESOURCE. We recommend using the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application is backed by a CloudFormation stack.
refs.ListAppVersionResourceMappingsResponse$r: Mappings used to map logical resources from the template to physical resources. You can use the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application template uses a logical stack name. Or you can map individual resources by using the mapping type RESOURCE. We recommend using the mapping type CFN_STACK if the application is backed by a CloudFormation stack.

refs.ResourceMapping$mappingType:
Specifies the type of resource mapping.

AppRegistryApp

The resource is mapped to another application. The name of the application is contained in the appRegistryAppName property.

CfnStack

The resource is mapped to a CloudFormation stack. The name of the CloudFormation stack is contained in the logicalStackName property.

Resource

The resource is mapped to another resource. The name of the resource is contained in the resourceName property.

ResourceGroup

The resource is mapped to a resource group. The name of the resource group is contained in the resourceGroupName property.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The specified resource could not be found.

refs.ConflictException$resourceType: The type of the resource that the exception applies to.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceType: The type of the resource that the exception applies to.

refs.ThrottlingException$retryAfterSeconds: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the operation.

S3Location.base: The location of the Amazon S3 bucket.

refs.DisruptionCompliance$achievableRpoInSecs: The Recovery Point Objective (RPO) that is achievable, in seconds.
refs.DisruptionCompliance$achievableRtoInSecs: The Recovery Time Objective (RTO) that is achievable, in seconds
refs.RecommendationDisruptionCompliance$expec: The expected RPO after applying the recommended configuration change.
The expected RTO after applying the recommended configuration change.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: You have exceeded your service quota. To perform the requested action, remove some of the relevant resources, or use Service Quotas to request a service quota increase.

refs.ListSopRecommendationsResponse$sopRecomm: The standard operating procedure (SOP) recommendations for the Resilience Hub applications.

refs.AlarmRecommendation$referenceId: The reference identifier of the alarm recommendation.
refs.ConfigRecommendation$referenceId: The reference identifier for the recommendation configuration.
refs.SopRecommendation$referenceId: The reference identifier for the SOP recommendation.
refs.TestRecommendation$referenceId: The reference identifier for the test recommendation.

refs.LogicalResourceId$logicalStackName: The name of the CloudFormation stack this resource belongs to.
refs.ResourceMapping$logicalStackName: The name of the CloudFormation stack this resource is mapped to.

refs.RemoveDraftAppVersionResourceMappingsReq: The names of the CloudFormation stacks to remove from the resource mappings.

refs.AppAssessment$message: Error or warning message from the assessment execution
refs.DescribeAppVersionResourcesResolutionSta: The returned error message for the request.
refs.DescribeDraftAppVersionResourcesImportSt: The returned error message for the request.
refs.RecommendationDisruptionCompliance$expec: The expected Recovery Point Objective (RPO) description after applying the recommended configuration change.
The expected Recovery Time Objective (RTO) description after applying the recommended configuration change.
refs.S3Location$bucket: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.
refs.S3Location$prefix: The prefix for the Amazon S3 bucket.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: The keys of the tags to remove.

The format for the recommendation template.

CfnJson

CfnYaml

The template is CloudFormation YAML.

refs.TestRecommendation$risk: The level of risk for this test recommendation.

refs.App$creationTime: The timestamp for when the app was created.
refs.App$lastAppComplianceEvaluationTime: The timestamp for the most recent compliance evaluation.
refs.App$lastResiliencyScoreEvaluationTime: The timestamp for the most recent resiliency score evaluation.
refs.AppSummary$creationTime: The timestamp for when the app was created.
refs.DescribeDraftAppVersionResourcesImportSt: The timestamp for when the status last changed.
refs.ResiliencyPolicy$creationTime: The timestamp for when the resiliency policy was created.
